newsitem.title: USA: High Plains Wheat-Mills aggressively bid for wheat.
newsitem.headline: High Plains Wheat-Mills aggressively bid for wheat.

text.p: Flour mills continued to be the best market for wheat, with some dealers reporting mills paying 20 cents per bushel over posted basis bids for rail cars of No. 1 or No. 2 grade hard red winter wheat.
"The mills are definitely driving the wheat market right now," said a south Kansas dealer.

Part of the demand was attributed to the expected late harvest from Texas to Kansas. Southern Kansas and Oklahoma dealers said cool spring weather slowed wheat development and harvest may be delayed until the first week of June instead of late May.
Rain fell in northwest Kansas late Thursday and early Friday, but amounts were light. Dealers said 0.15 to 0.60 inch fell in northwest Kansas, which should aid the wheat.
Basis values in cents/bu against KCBT wheat, cash=dollars/bu.
Houston unq + N unq + N na
(Note: N=KCBT July. unq- unquoted, na - not applicable)
